pros: I loved working for SEBTS. The people were amazing and sweet. The benefits and flexibility were also wonderful! They truly care about you and your education, regardless of your position.

review_title: Benefits make up for pay; environment depends on office
pros: Christian company that truly loves and cares about their employees. The amazing benefits (premiums paid by company 100%) make up for low wages.
cons: Work environment depends on the individual office and the personalities that work there.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Wake Forest, NC
pros: Leadership have a strong vision of the mission of the institution. Encouraged to further education and career training. High level of trust and support. Given personnel and project management assignments that allowed me to refine and grow current skill sets as well as learn and gain experience in new skills. Excellent personnel policies with regards to family. Good benefits.
cons: Seminary personnel work in an atmosphere of either fear or well being. There's no middle ground. One must be careful to avoid the scrutiny of the president or his hand picked staff. You're either "in" or you're looking for new employment. Compensation is poor.

pros: Great, values-based environment. Flexible hours and a boss that was understanding about when things would come up.
cons: Not a lot of direction from my direct supervisor. It seemed like we were just getting the job done, but with no long-range goal in sight.
